intro: Gilia californica var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular gilia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, typically pink or red flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits called capsules, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. The glandular hairs on its stems and leaves are a distinguishing feature of this variety.
